v.v: This is the word of Yahweh that came to Micah the Morashtite in the days of Jotham, Ahaz, and Hezekiah, kings of Judah, which he saw concerning Samaria and Jerusalem.
Look, Yahweh comes out of his place;
The mountains will melt under him;
All this is because of the Jacob’s transgression,
“I will make Samaria a heap of ruins in the field,
All her carved figures will be broken to pieces,
For this reason I will lament and wail;
Do not tell about it in Gath;
For the inhabitants of Maroth wait anxiously for good news,
Harness the chariot to the team of horses, inhabitants of Lachish.
So you will give a parting gift to Moresheth Gath;
I will again bring a conqueror to you,

v: Listen, earth, and all that is in you.
Let the Lord Yahweh be a witness against you,
the Lord from his holy temple.
he will come down and tread
on the high places of the earth.
the valleys will break apart,
like wax before fire,
like waters that are poured down a steep place.
and because of the sins of the house of Israel.
What is Jacob’s transgression?
Is it not Samaria?
What is Judah’s high place?
Is it not Jerusalem?
a place for planting vineyards,
and I will pour her stones down into the valley
and I will uncover her foundations.
and all her gifts that she received will be burned with fire,
and I will destroy all her idols.
Since she gathered her gifts from the wages of prostitutes,
they will become the wages of prostitutes again.”
I will go barefoot and naked;
I will wail like the jackals
and mourn like owls.
for it has come to Judah.
It has reached the gate of my people,
to Jerusalem.
do not weep at all.
At Beth Leaphrah I roll myself in the dust.
in nakedness and shame.
The inhabitants of Zaanan do not come out.
Beth Ezel mourns,
for their protection is taken away.
because disaster has come down from Yahweh
to the gates of Jerusalem.
You, Lachish, were the beginning of sin for the daughter of Zion,
for the transgressions of Israel were found in you.
the town of Akzib will disappoint the kings of Israel.
inhabitants of Mareshah;
the splendor of Israel will come to Adullam.
and cut off your hair
for the children in whom you delight.
Make yourself as bald as eagles,
for your children will go into exile from you.
